description.narrative: The Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) Trade and Transport Facilitation initiative provides funding through the Asian Development Bank (ADB) in support of ADB's project on Trade and Transport Facilitation in the GMS. The project aims to address the most significant constraints to efficient cross-border trade in the Mekong, building on previous aid program support to Cross Border Transport Agreement (CBTA) implementation. The objective is to reduce the time need to export and import goods in the GMS through work at three levels: transport facilitation, trade facilitation and regulatory/legal reform. The potential gains offered by reduced trade times are significant. For each reduction by one day in the time taken to export, for example, GDP for GMS countries could increase by up to 1.2 per cent. This reflects the important role of trade in economic growth in the GMS. This project complements Australia's investments of approximately $127 million in physical connectivity infrastructure pro
